findings.title: Centralization Risk
findings.description: The contract owner can adjust the tax to as high as 100% on transactions, limit the tradeable limit of each user’s balance. The owner account should be taken care to not be mismanaged else the privileges associated with the account can slip into the hands of the hacker.

findings.title: Frontrunning
findings.description: Upon deployment, the expected contract owner would have to call initialize() else the owner characteristics and privileges do not get set. This is an issue for two reasons: If anyone asides from the intended owner calls initialize, they automatically become the owner of the Advon contract with the privileges of the owner address.

findings.title: Token allocation and transfers
findings.description: Arithmetic calculations determine token locking and transfer to users, but checks are inaccurate, allowing potential exploitation of vulnerabilities in functions such as setReleaseTime(), setSupply_Team_Allocation(), setBuyandSellTax(), and setTokenPrice(). Additionally, eligible reseller check issues can lead to improper accounting.

findings.title: Low code and documentation readability
findings.description: The smart contract's code and documentation lack clarity and readability, making it difficult to understand the intended behavior.
